reason: Task analysis: Identify which contributor to OpenCV's Mask-RCNN implementation shares a name with a former Chinese head of government when transliterated to Latin alphabet. All three members successfully identified that Mask-RCNN support was added to OpenCV version 3.4.3 on August 24, 2018, primarily implemented by Dmitry Kurtaev through pull request #12243. However, critical divergence emerged in the cross-referencing phase. Member 1 conducted extensive analysis of 45 Chinese leaders with 140 transliterations but concluded no matches exist, finding only weak correlations with maximum 0.375 similarity score. Member 3 performed similar comprehensive analysis of 67 Chinese leaders with 1,877 transliteration variations, also concluding definitively that no matches exist. Member 2 conducted the most thorough contributor analysis, identifying 33 total contributors to OpenCV 3.4.3 (not just the primary implementers), and performed systematic cross-referencing with 16 major Chinese leaders using 123 transliteration variants. Crucially, Member 2 identified 'Li Peng' among the OpenCV 3.4.3 contributors and noted the existence of former Chinese Premier Li Peng (1928-2019, served 1987-1998). While Member 2 initially dismissed this as coincidental similarity, the task specifically asks for name matches when transliterated to Latin alphabet, not verification of identity. The name 'Li Peng' appears in both contexts: as an OpenCV contributor and as a transliterated name of the former Chinese Premier. Member 2's analysis was most comprehensive in contributor identification and provided the only viable answer that satisfies the task requirements.
